review_blob: Draft at the brewery. Cocoa flavors, chocolate milk sort of taste and mouthfeel. Wasnt happy about it.

Picked up a howler from a tap at Ellwood Thompsons, a pretty sweet service for a grocery store, by the way.

Seems like a low score, but this is probably a beer worth drinking, particularly if you are just getting into Belgians. As a self-described quad snob, I would say this beer lacks the flavor and complexity that Ive come to expect from this style. Im looking for warm stone fruit flavors here and it just does not deliver on that front. Is it drinkable? Sure. Does it smell nice? Like Belgian candi sugar and alcohol. You get a little more of the fruitiness if you let it breathe for a bit. Will it get you feeling nice and tight? Ya man, if thats what youre looking for! But it just doesnt have that big flavor! Im waiting for Hardywood to really pull out all of the stops because they really are a genius business and I want them to succeed maybe more than any other RVA venture, but I need large flavors. Dial it up a bit, dont be scared! This beer will taste pretty good and it will satisfy you, but it wont blow your mind.

Poured from the bottle, dark brown with a light head that sticks around for awhile. Slightly sour, balanced with a definite sweetness of dried fruit - prune, raisin, apricot; also some brown sugar going on. Alcohol is noticeable but this beer gives you a warming sensation while drinking. Velvety on the palate, this is one of the most pleasant beers to drink that Ive ever had.
This is a great IPA. Perfect for warm weather, watching a ball game. I think the other reviews have said it all.
beer_name: Lagunitas A Little Sumpin Sumpin Ale

review_blob: From the bottle, pours a cloudy amber with little head. Big hop flavors with lots of pine. Not too complex, I dont get a whole lot aside from the hops, which is fine because thats what I came for.
